required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multifocal vs Monofocal IOL in Congenital Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Analysis of Visual Outcomes of Multifocal and Monofocal Intraocular Lenses in Congenital Cataract Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Bambino Gesù Hospital and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Bambino Gesù Hospital and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate long-term outcome after congenital cataract surgery comparing results achieved with multifocal and monofocal IOLs.

detailed_description.textblock:
PURPOSE: To assess the impact on visual development of multifocal versus monofocal intraocular lenses (IOLs) implantation in children following congenital cataract surgery.
DESIGN: Retrospective interventional consecutive case series. METHODS: We reviewed the records of 56 eyes of 43 pediatric patients who underwent congenital cataract surgery with phacoaspiration and simultaneous implantation of IOL under one year of age. Corrected distance visual acuity (CDVA), refractive error and ocular motility disorders were evaluated after a follow-up greater than 4 years.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CDVA was evaluated after 4 years of age.
primary_outcome.description: Corrected distance visual acuity (CDVA), calculated in logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR), using standard Snellen charts

arm_group.description: patients with unilateral and bilateral multifocal IOL
patients with unilateral and bilateral monofocal IOL

intervention.description: All patients underwent cataract surgery under 1 year of age (mean age 8 months, range 6-12) performed with the same surgical technique: two 1.2 mm clear corneal incision, continuous curvilinear capsulorhexis with a diameter of approximately 6.0 mm and intraocular lens implantation, posterior capsulotomy and anterior vitrectomy. IOL power was calculated using Sanders-Retzlaff-Kraff (SRK)/II formula. Multifocal IOL implantated was Alcon AcrySof ReSTOR SN60D3, while the monofocal one was Alcon AcrySof SN60AT. According to the Infant Aphakia treatment Study, the IOL power was calculated as a function of the child age17, with an undercorrection ranging from 4 to 6 D.

study_pop.textblock: We reviewed the records of 56 eyes of 43 pediatric patients who underwent congenital cataract surgery with phacoaspiration and simultaneous implantation of IOL under one year of age. All patients were directed to our hospital from primary care ophthalmologists or pediatricians

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- unilateral congenital cataract
- bilateral congenital cataract
Exclusion Criteria:
- other ocular pathologies (such as glaucoma, microphthalmia, micro - or megalocornea, persistent fetal vasculature, retinal congenital disease, corneal scar, traumatic cataracts)
- systemic diseases (such as chromosomal abnormalities, prematurity or mental retardation)

overall_official.affiliation: Bambino Gesù Children's Hospital, Rome, Italy

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Bambino Gesù Hospital and Research Institute

patient_data.ipd_description: All the data are stored in the Bambino Gesù Children's Hospital data base
